business.headline: Budget 2025: Key proposals for FDs, and long-term savingsTax incentives for fixed deposits and boost middle-class savings could redefine savings strategies in Budget 2025.

Oil India, ONGC shares jump 5% today. What's fuelling the rally?The rally can be attributed to global policy measures aimed at economic revival, which investors believe could boost fuel demand and enhance earnings for upstream oil companies.

Explained: Why Jai Corp share price hit 52-week low todayThe steep decline in Jai Corp's share price over two sessions stems from a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), where Jai Corp holds a 32% equity stake.

5 tax-saving tips for young professionals in 2025Proactive financial planning helps young professionals save taxes, build wealth, and reach goals with strategies like early planning, goal-based investing, and health insurance, etc.

While auto and IT stocks had propelled a rally just a day ago, profit booking amid prevailing uncertainty appears to have weighed heavily on sentiment.

Kabeer Biswas may call it quits as Dunzo battles cash crisis: Report The Bengaluru-based quick commerce platform has faced a challenging period over the last 12–18 months, marked by cash flow issues and difficulties in raising fresh funds.

Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Check allotment status, GMP and listing dateIndo Farm IPO allotment status:: Investors who wish to check Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment can do so by visiting the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the registrar's online portal, which is Mas Services Limited.

Can unregistered small businesses receive GST notices?The annual turnover threshold for GST registration is Rs 40 lakh for businesses supplying goods and Rs 20 lakh for service providers. Businesses below these limits are exempt, but exceeding them triggers registration and compliance requirements.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Situation in China not unusual: Health Ministry urges calm amid HMPV spread scareThe Health Ministry highlighted that India's robust surveillance systems and healthcare resources are well-equipped to handle respiratory illnesses, including those caused by the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV).

Maverick Sydney Test knock shows why Rishabh Pant shouldn't be tamedRishabh Pant's electrifying 33-ball 61 on Day 2 of the Sydney Test was a masterclass in counter-attacking cricket, reigniting India's hopes of retaining the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. With audacious stroke play and fearless intent, Pant reminded his critics that he cannot be tamed.

Twist in journalist's murder: Key accused identified as Mukesh Chandrakar's cousinMukesh Chandrakar, a 28-year-old journalist known for his hard-hitting investigative reports, recently exposed alleged corruption in a Rs 120-crore road construction project. He was found dead in a property belonging to Suresh Chandrakar, who was named in the corruption report.

Saamana praises Fadnavis, Pawars to bury hatchet; what's going on in Maharashtra?After days of calls for reunion rumblings in the NCP, Shiv Sena (UBT)'s mouthpiece Saamana praised Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis, saying, "Congratulations, Deva Bhau" for his efforts to eliminate Naxalites in the state. Is something changing in Maharashtra politics?

Chinese chatter intensifies on HMPV as new respiratory infections surgeVarious reports in the Chinese media highlight how the emergency departments, infectious disease units, fever clinics, and infusion rooms at different children's hospitals in the country are packed with people.

4 soldiers killed after Army truck rolls down hill in Jammu and KashmirAn Army truck lost control while negotiating a sharp curve and rolled down a hill in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipore district, killing four soldiers and injuring three others.

Rohit Sharma should play for Mumbai in Ranji Trophy: Sunil GavaskarBorder Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: In an exclusive interview with India Today, Sunil Gavaskar said that Rohit Sharma should play for Mumbai in the Ranji Trophy to regain his lost touch with the bat in hand.

Princes William and Harry's ex-nanny's stepson among New Orleans attack victimsPrince William and his wife, Catherine, have expressed their deep sorrow following the death of Edward Pettifer, a 31-year-old British man with close ties to the royal family, in a New Year's Day terror attack in New Orleans.

With Raja Saabs returning to cinemas, will 2025 be the Sikandar at box office?The Indian film industry is poised for a significant year in 2025 with a star-studded lineup, aiming to draw audiences back to theatres post-pandemic. With major releases across languages, the industry hopes for a pan-India success and increased footfall in cinemas. Trade experts Girish Johar and Ramesh Bala share their insights.

As Prashant Kishor sits on indefinite fast, his luxury vanity van feeds frenzyAmid Prashant Kishor's fast-unto-death, photos of his luxury vanity van parked at the site of the protest at Patna's Gandhi Maidan have gone viral, sparking buzz on social media.

Bengaluru techie suicide case: Atul Subhash's wife, in-laws get bailBengaluru techie Atul Subhash died by suicide on December 9 after alleging harassment by his wife Nikita Singhania and her family, including his mother-in-law.

Moon flanked by Venus and Saturn in stunning alignment over IndiaShortly after sunset, the southwestern horizon is playing host to the stunning planetary conjunction, offering skywatchers a breathtaking view of these three celestial bodies converging.

Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma unfollow each other, spark divorce rumoursChahal and Dhanashree's rumored split has left fans stunned. Reports of divorce, fuelled by their Instagram activity and deleted posts, signal an end to their once-adored love story. Neither has addressed the speculation, keeping fans guessing.

Why South's second Sanatana Dharma row has reformer Narayana Guru at the centreKerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan's comments on Sanatana Dharma have ignited a fresh debate, with social reformer and saint, Narayana Guru, at the centre. Known for his teachings of equality and social harmony, why is the 19th-century reformer at the heart of southern India's second Sanatana Dharma row?

Air hostess duped of Rs 10 lakh after being threatened with arrest in fake caseA Maharashtra-based air hostess was duped of Rs 9.93 lakh by fraudsters who falsely claimed she was linked to a money-laundering case and coerced her into transferring the money under the pretext of avoiding arrest.

Loneliness is not just bad for your mental health, it also causes infectionsNew research reveals that staying socially connected not only benefits mental health but may also protect against diseases like heart disease and diabetes.

Diljit Dosanjh proposes global Indian music festivals to PM ModiPunjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh recently met PM Modi, discussing India's potential to host music festivals bigger than Coachella. They shared visions for elevating India's cultural scene globally.

Sydney pitch not ideal for Test cricket: Sunil GavaskarFormer India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the green pitch in the ongoing fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground is not ideal for playing international red-ball cricket. After 11 wickets fell on day one, day two saw an additional 15 wickets tumble. India, having bowled out Australia for 181, took a slender four-run first-innings lead and reached 141/6 at stumps, extending their overall lead to 145.

Responding to Jasprit Bumrah's niggle, McDonald said, "He is a threat any time. And, yeah, if he isn't there, then India would have to come up with a new plan."

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
